description: This Award Winning Short Rib and Chorizo Chili is packed with tender beef and bold flavors, making it the perfect comfort food for any occasion. With its rich and hearty ingredients, it's sure to become a favorite in your household.
ingredients: 1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, brown the short ribs over medium-high heat, then remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add chorizo and cook until browned, then add onion and garlic, cooking until softened.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper, cooking for another minute.
Add the fire-roasted tomatoes, beef broth, and short ribs back to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1.5 to 2 hours until the ribs are tender.
Remove the short ribs, shred the meat, and return it to the pot along with the kidney beans.
Simmer for an additional 15 minutes before serving.
tips: For the best flavor, let the chili sit for a few hours or overnight before serving. This allows the spices to meld beautifully.

Preparation:
Start by browning the short ribs and cooking the chorizo with onions and garlic to build flavor.
Cooking/Baking Process:

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Letting the chili simmer for longer enhances the flavors significantly.
  • Avoid overcooking the beans; add them towards the end of cooking.
  • Look for the meat to be fork-tender as a sign it's ready.
  • This chili stores well in the fridge and can be reheated easily.

structured_content.content: This chili is more than just food; it's a way to connect with loved ones. Sharing a bowl of this hearty dish brings warmth and joy, making every gathering memorable.
Consider adding fresh cilantro, a squeeze of lime, or diced avocado on top for a fresh twist. You can also experiment with different types of beans or peppers for added flavor.
Serve with crusty bread, cornbread, or over rice for a complete meal. Pair with a light salad or a refreshing beverage to balance the richness.
For a lighter version, substitute turkey for beef and use a variety of beans. You can also make it vegetarian by omitting the meat and adding more vegetables.
